original_title: Sri Lanka beat Ireland by an innings and 10 runs
original_body_lines: Sri Lanka recorded an emphatic innings and 10-run win over Ireland in the second Test in Galle, to complete a sweep of the series.
Right-arm spinner Ramesh Mendis took 5 for 64, the fourth five-wicket haul of his career, with fast-bowler Asitha Fernando picking up the final two wickets, for figures of 3 for 30.
